Components of Deferred Tax Liabilities [Abstract]
Fixed and intangible assets
DeferredTaxLiabilitiesPlantAndEquipmentAndIntangibleAssets

The amount as of the balance sheet date of the estimated future tax effects attributable to the difference between the tax basis of capital assets and intangible assets and the basis of capital assets and intangible assets computed in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. The difference in basis, attributable to different capitalization of costs, depreciation, or amortization methodologies, impairment charges, or other reasons will increase future taxable income when such basis difference is realized. Capital assets include but are not limited to assets such as land, real estate, leasehold improvements, machinery and equipment and furniture and fixtures.
